text.section: A person may not knowingly and intentionally obtain a Program participant's actual address or telephone number from the Secretary of State or any agency without authorization to obtain the information.

section.section:
This subsection applies only when an employee of the Secretary of State:
obtains a Program participant's actual address or telephone number during the course of the employee's official duties; and
at the time of disclosure, has specific knowledge that the actual address or telephone number belongs to a Program participant.

An employee of the Secretary of State or any agency may not knowingly and intentionally disclose a Program participant's actual address or telephone number to another person unless the disclosure is authorized by law.

text.section: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $2,500.
